overview.title: Connect365 User Guide
overview.welcome: Welcome to Connect365 - a powerful WebRTC SIP phone designed for Autocab365 taxi dispatch systems. This guide will help you get started and make the most of all available features.
overview.quick_link_calls_desc: Learn how to place and receive calls

installation.title: Installation
installation.intro: Connect365 is a Progressive Web App (PWA) that can be installed on your device for a native app experience.
installation.desktop_step1: Open Connect365 in your browser (Chrome, Edge, or Safari recommended)
installation.desktop_step2: Look for the install button in the address bar or browser menu
installation.desktop_step3: Click "Install" to add Connect365 to your desktop
installation.desktop_step4: The app will open in its own window, separate from your browser
installation.tip_pwa: Installing Connect365 as a PWA provides better performance, offline capabilities, and notifications.

first_setup.title: First Time Setup
first_setup.intro: Before you can make calls, you need to configure your connection settings with your Phantom ID and SIP credentials.
first_setup.welcome_screen_desc: When you first launch Connect365, you'll see a welcome screen prompting you to configure your connection settings. Click the Go to Settings button to begin the setup process.
first_setup.step1_desc: If you've dismissed the welcome screen, you can access settings manually:
first_setup.step1_item1: Click the Settings tab in the tab navigation bar
first_setup.step1_item2: The Connection settings section should open automatically
first_setup.step2_desc: You'll need the following information from your administrator:
first_setup.step3_item3: Click the Connect button at the top of the app to connect to Phantom
first_setup.step3_item4: Wait for the registration status to show "Registered"
first_setup.tip_phantom_id: The Phantom ID automatically generates the correct server URLs for your connection. You don't need to manually enter server addresses.
first_setup.tip_connect: Saving your settings does not automatically connect you to Phantom. You must press the Connect button in the header to initiate the connection and register with the server.
first_setup.warning_microphone: Make sure your browser has microphone permissions enabled. You'll be prompted to allow access when you first make or receive a call.

quick_start.title: Quick Start Guide
quick_start.intro: Once you're set up, here's how to perform common tasks:
quick_start.first_call_step2: Ensure you are logged in with your agent details (see Agent Controls)
quick_start.first_call_step3: Enter a phone number using the dialpad
quick_start.first_call_step5: Use the call controls during the call (mute, hold, transfer, etc.)
quick_start.view_history_step3: Click the callback icon to return to the Phone tab with the number pre-filled

agent_controls.title: Agent Controls
agent_controls.intro: Connect365 provides dedicated agent controls for call center operations. The agent control buttons are located at the top of the dialpad and allow you to manage your agent status within the Phantom PBX system.
agent_controls.status_desc: The status bar below the header shows your current connection and agent state:
agent_controls.status_no_connection_desc: Your phone is not registered to the SIP server. Press the Connect button at the top of the screen to register.
agent_controls.status_not_logged_in_desc: You are connected to the server but not logged in as an agent. Press the Login button to sign in.
agent_controls.status_logged_in_desc: You are logged in as an agent. Your agent number and name are displayed.
agent_controls.status_paused_desc: You are logged in but currently paused (unavailable to receive queue calls).
agent_controls.login_desc: The Login button controls your agent session with the Phantom PBX.
agent_controls.login_action_login: Click to open the agent login dialog. Enter your agent number and optional passcode to log in.
agent_controls.login_action_logout: Click to log out of your agent session. Your agent number will be cleared and you will no longer receive queue calls.
agent_controls.login_tip: When you log in, Connect365 first attempts to use the API method. If that fails, it automatically falls back to DTMF-based login by dialing the agent login code.
agent_controls.queue_desc: The Queue button manages your membership in call queues.
agent_controls.queue_action_join: You are not currently in any queue. Click to open the queue selection dialog and join queues.
agent_controls.queue_action_manage: You are logged into one or more queues. Click to manage your queue membership or log out of queues.
agent_controls.queue_action_disabled: You must be logged in as an agent before you can join queues.
agent_controls.pause_desc: The Pause button allows you to temporarily make yourself unavailable for queue calls without logging out.
agent_controls.pause_action_pause: You are available to receive queue calls. Click to pause - you may be prompted to select a pause reason.
agent_controls.pause_action_resume: You are currently paused. Click to resume and become available for queue calls again.
agent_controls.pause_action_disabled: You must be logged in as an agent before you can pause.
agent_controls.pause_warning: While paused, you will not receive any calls from queues. Direct calls to your extension will still ring through. Remember to unpause when you are ready to take calls again.
agent_controls.pause_tip: You can pause while on an active call. The pause will take effect immediately without interrupting your current conversation.

making_calls.title: Making Calls
making_calls.intro: Connect365 provides multiple ways to initiate and manage calls.
making_calls.outbound_intro: There are several ways to make an outbound call:
making_calls.method1_step2: Click numbers on the dialpad or type using your keyboard
making_calls.method1_step3: Click the green Call button or press Enter
making_calls.method2_step2: Find the contact you want to call
making_calls.method2_step3: Click the phone icon next to their name
making_calls.method3_step2: Find the call you want to return
making_calls.method3_step3: Click the phone icon to call back
making_calls.receiving_step1: You'll see an incoming call notification
making_calls.receiving_step2: The caller's number will be displayed. If the number matches a saved contact, the contact name will be shown instead
making_calls.tip_notifications: If enabled in Settings > Call Settings, incoming calls will show a desktop notification in your taskbar. You can click the notification to answer the call directly.
making_calls.tip_autofocus: When enabled in Settings > Call Settings, incoming calls will automatically bring the app to the foreground and switch to the Phone tab.
making_calls.tip_autoanswer_intro: There are two ways to enable auto-answer:
making_calls.tip_autoanswer_app: App Auto Answer (Settings > Call Settings): Automatically answers all incoming calls
making_calls.tip_autoanswer_phantom: Phantom *11: When enabled on the Phantom PBX server, automatically answers queue and group calls only. DDI and internal calls will ring as normal.
making_calls.controls_intro: During an active call, you have access to several controls:
making_calls.control_transfer_desc: Transfer the call to another extension
making_calls.transfer_intro: There are two types of call transfers:
making_calls.transfer_blind: Blind Transfer: Transfer immediately without speaking to the recipient
making_calls.transfer_attended: Attended Transfer: Speak with the recipient before completing the transfer
making_calls.transfer_step1: Click the Transfer button during a call
making_calls.transfer_step2: Enter the extension or number to transfer to
making_calls.transfer_tip: You can set your preferred default transfer method in Settings > Call Settings. This default is used when pressing Enter in the transfer dialog or when transferring via BLF buttons.
making_calls.line_keys_intro: Line keys allow you to manage multiple simultaneous calls, similar to traditional desk phones. Each line represents a separate call session with its own state and controls.
making_calls.line_keys_screenshot: Screenshot: Line keys overview with multiple call states
making_calls.line_keys_states_intro: Each line key displays different visual indicators depending on its current state:
making_calls.line_state_idle_desc: Line is available and ready for a new call
making_calls.line_state_ringing_in_desc: Incoming call waiting to be answered. Shows incoming caller ID or contact name
making_calls.line_state_ringing_out_desc: Outgoing call dialing. Shows the number being called
making_calls.line_state_active_desc: Call is connected and in progress. Shows call CLI
making_calls.line_state_held_desc: Call is on hold. Shows CLI with yellow "HOLD" text
making_calls.line_keys_info_intro: Each line key shows relevant information about the call:
making_calls.line_keys_info_caller: Caller Identification: Shows the contact name if saved, otherwise displays the phone number
making_calls.line_keys_info_direction: Call Direction: Indicates if the call is inbound (‚Üì) or outbound (‚Üë)
making_calls.line_keys_info_status: Call Status: Current state (Ringing, Connected, On Hold)
making_calls.line_keys_switching_intro: When managing multiple calls, you can easily switch between line keys by clicking on them:
making_calls.line_keys_switching_step1: Click on any line key to make it the active line
making_calls.line_keys_switching_step2: The currently selected line is highlighted with a border or background color
making_calls.line_keys_switching_step3: Call controls (mute, hold, transfer, hangup) apply to the currently selected line
making_calls.line_keys_autohold_intro: Connect365 includes an intelligent automatic hold feature that manages your calls when switching between lines:
making_calls.line_keys_autohold_how_desc: When you switch from an active call to another line (to answer a new call or to make an outgoing call), the current call is automatically placed on hold. This prevents the other party from hearing your conversation on the new line.
making_calls.line_keys_autohold_example_step1: You're on an active call with a customer on Line 1
making_calls.line_keys_autohold_example_step2: A new call comes in on Line 2
making_calls.line_keys_autohold_example_step3: You click on Line 2 to answer the incoming call
making_calls.line_keys_autohold_example_step4: Automatically: Line 1 is placed on hold, and Line 2 becomes active
making_calls.line_keys_autohold_example_step5: Line 1 now shows the "On Hold" state with the pause icon ‚è∏Ô∏è
making_calls.line_keys_unhold_intro: When you switch back to a line that was automatically placed on hold, you must manually resume the call:
making_calls.line_keys_unhold_step1: Click on the line key that is on hold to select it
making_calls.line_keys_unhold_step2: Click the Resume or Unhold button to reconnect with the caller
making_calls.line_keys_unhold_step3: The line will return to the active state, and you can continue your conversation
making_calls.line_keys_unhold_note: Note: The call does not automatically resume when you click on a held line. This gives you time to prepare before reconnecting with the caller.
making_calls.line_keys_tip_limits: Line Limits: Connect365 supports 3 simultaneous call lines
making_calls.line_keys_tip_overflow: Line Full: If all lines are in use, you won't be able to make a new call until a line becomes available
making_calls.line_keys_tip_call_waiting: Multiple Queue Calls: To receive more than one incoming queue call simultaneously, call waiting must be enabled on your agent profile
making_calls.line_keys_tip_monitoring: Visual Monitoring: Keep an eye on all line keys to see incoming calls and held calls at a glance
making_calls.line_keys_call_waiting_desc: When you receive a second or third incoming call while already on an active call:
making_calls.line_keys_call_waiting_beep: Audio Alert: You will hear a call waiting beep instead of a full ringtone
making_calls.line_keys_call_waiting_no_tray: No Tray Notifications: Desktop/taskbar notifications will not appear for call waiting calls
making_calls.line_keys_call_waiting_visual: Visual Indicator: The Dial tab will flash red to alert you of the incoming call, providing an additional visual cue along with the call waiting tone
making_calls.line_keys_call_waiting_note: This behavior helps distinguish between your first incoming call (which rings normally with full notifications) and subsequent calls waiting on other lines.

contacts.title: Contacts Management
contacts.intro: Manage your contacts to quickly call frequently dialed numbers.
contacts.add_note: Note: At least one of First Name, Last Name, or Company Name is required.
contacts.edit_step1: Find the contact in your contacts list
contacts.edit_step2: Click the three dots menu icon on the contact
contacts.delete_step1: Find the contact you want to delete
contacts.delete_step2: Click the three dots menu icon on the contact
contacts.search_desc: Use the search box at the top of the Contacts tab to quickly find contacts by name or number.
contacts.tip: Click the phone icon next to any contact to return to the Phone tab with the number pre-filled.

call_history.title: Call History
call_history.intro: View and manage your call history in the Activity tab.
call_history.view_desc: The Activity tab shows all your recent calls with the following information:
call_history.actions_desc: For each call history entry, you can:
call_history.action_callback: Call Back: Click the phone icon to return the call

blf.title: BLF Monitoring
blf.intro: Busy Lamp Field (BLF) buttons allow you to monitor the status of other extensions and quickly dial or transfer calls to them.
blf.enable_desc: BLF buttons must be enabled before they appear on the Phone tab:
blf.enable_step3: Return to the Phone tab to see the BLF button panels
blf.config_step1: Right-click on any BLF button slot to open the configuration modal
blf.config_type_speeddial: Speed Dial: Quick dial button without presence monitoring
blf.config_step3: Enter the extension number (3-5 digits for BLF) or phone number (for Speed Dial)
blf.states_desc: BLF buttons display different colours to indicate the monitored extension's status:
blf.state_available_desc: The extension is idle and available to receive calls
blf.state_busy_desc: The extension is currently on a call
blf.state_ringing_desc: The extension has an incoming call
blf.state_hold_desc: The extension has a call on hold
blf.state_inactive_desc: The extension status is unknown or not registered
blf.hold_tip: The Hold state requires additional Phantom PBX server configuration. If you need to monitor hold states, please contact support to raise a ticket with the Phantom support team.
blf.usage_desc: BLF buttons provide quick access to common actions:
blf.usage_click_call: Click (during call): Transfer the current call to that extension
blf.usage_rightclick: Right-click: Open configuration to edit or clear the button
blf.transfer_tip: When configuring a BLF button, you can set a transfer method override (blind or attended) that will be used instead of your default transfer setting when transferring via that button.

voicemail.title: Voicemail
voicemail.intro: Connect365 provides a voicemail indicator that displays new message notifications and provides quick access to your voicemail.
voicemail.indicator_desc: The voicemail indicator appears in the status bar on the Phone tab. It shows:
voicemail.indicator_item1: A voicemail icon that is always visible
voicemail.indicator_item2: When new messages are waiting, the icon will flash and display the number of new messages
voicemail.access_desc: Click the voicemail icon to automatically dial your voicemail access code. The access code is configured in your Connection Settings (default is *97).
voicemail.access_tip: The voicemail access code can be set in Settings > Connection Settings under "VM Access". If not configured, clicking the voicemail icon will display a reminder to set it up.
voicemail.new_desc: When you have new voicemail messages:
voicemail.new_item1: The voicemail icon will flash to draw your attention
voicemail.new_item2: The number of new messages will be displayed (e.g. "5 New")

company_numbers.title: Company Numbers
company_numbers.intro: Company Numbers allows you to manage multiple outbound caller IDs (CLI) and quickly switch between them when making calls.
company_numbers.enable_step2: Enable the Company Numbers tab in the Visible Tabs section
company_numbers.enable_step4: Add at least one company number
company_numbers.selector_desc: Once Company Numbers is enabled and at least one number has been added, a CLI selector will appear on the Phone tab above the dialpad. This selector allows you to:
company_numbers.selector_item1: View your currently active outbound number
company_numbers.selector_item2: Click to open a dropdown of all available company numbers
company_numbers.selector_item3: Select a different number to use for outgoing calls
company_numbers.switch_desc: To change your outbound caller ID:
company_numbers.switch_step1: Click the CLI selector dropdown on the Phone tab
company_numbers.switch_step2: Select the company number you wish to use
company_numbers.switch_step4: The system will dial a code to update your CLI on the Phantom PBX server
company_numbers.tip: When you confirm a CLI change, Connect365 automatically dials the appropriate code to update your outbound caller ID on the Phantom PBX. Your selected number will be used for all subsequent outgoing calls until changed.
company_numbers.sync_tip: When you log in as an agent, the CLI selector will automatically sync to display the current CLI associated with your agent session.
company_numbers.warning: This feature requires additional programming on the Phantom PBX. Please contact support to raise a ticket with the Phantom team to enable Company Numbers for your system.

queue_monitor.title: Queue Monitor
queue_monitor.intro: The Queue Monitor provides real-time visibility into call queue performance, helping supervisors and agents track SLA (Service Level Agreement) compliance and manage workload effectively.
queue_monitor.enable_step2: Enable the Queue Monitor tab in the Visible Tabs section
queue_monitor.add_step2: Select a queue from the available list (or select a queue group)
queue_monitor.add_missed_warning: Missed % Warning - Percentage at which yellow warning appears
queue_monitor.add_missed_breach: Missed % Breach - Percentage at which red breach alert appears
queue_monitor.add_wait_warning: Avg Wait Time Warning - Seconds at which yellow warning appears
queue_monitor.add_wait_breach: Avg Wait Time Breach - Seconds at which red breach alert appears
queue_monitor.stats_desc: Each monitored queue displays the following metrics in a grid format:
queue_monitor.stat_queue_desc: Queue number and name. Column header shows alert status colour.
queue_monitor.stat_agents_desc: Total number of agents assigned to the queue
queue_monitor.stat_free_desc: Number of agents available to take calls
queue_monitor.stat_busy_desc: Number of agents currently on calls
queue_monitor.stat_paused_desc: Number of agents in paused state
queue_monitor.stat_waiting_desc: Number of calls currently waiting in queue
queue_monitor.stat_awt_desc: Average wait time in seconds (SLA tracked)
queue_monitor.alert_desc: The Queue Monitor uses colour-coded alerts to indicate SLA status:
queue_monitor.alert_yellow_desc: Metric has reached warning threshold - attention needed
queue_monitor.alert_red_desc: Metric has exceeded breach threshold - immediate action required
queue_monitor.tab_alert_desc: Even when you're not viewing the Queue Monitor tab, the tab icon will flash to alert you of SLA issues:
queue_monitor.tab_alert_yellow: Slow yellow flash - One or more queues have reached warning threshold
queue_monitor.tab_alert_red: Fast red flash - One or more queues are in breach status
queue_monitor.tab_alert_note: This allows you to continue working in other tabs while still being alerted to queue performance issues.
queue_monitor.sort_desc: Queues in the monitor are automatically sorted by alert priority:
queue_monitor.sort_normal: Normal queues appear last, sorted by queue number
queue_monitor.manage_desc: Each queue in the monitor has action buttons:
queue_monitor.manage_edit: Edit (pencil icon) - Modify SLA thresholds for the queue
queue_monitor.manage_delete: Delete (trash icon) - Remove the queue from monitoring
queue_monitor.manage_delete_all: Use the Delete All button in the header to remove all monitored queues at once.
queue_monitor.connection_desc: The Queue Monitor header displays the current connection status:
queue_monitor.connection_connected: Connected (green wifi icon) - Real-time data streaming active
queue_monitor.connection_disconnected: Disconnected (red wifi icon) - No live data connection
queue_monitor.realtime_tip: Real-time Updates: Queue statistics update in real-time via Socket.IO when connected. If the socket connection is lost, the display will show the last known values until reconnection.
queue_monitor.groups_tip: Using Queue Groups: When adding queues, you can select a queue group (configured in Settings > Queues) to quickly add multiple queues with the same SLA thresholds.

connection_settings.title: Connection Settings
connection_settings.intro: Configure your SIP connection credentials in Settings > Connection. These settings determine which Phantom PBX server you connect to and your device identity.
connection_settings.phantom_id_desc: A 3-4 digit identifier that specifies which Phantom PBX server to connect to. This is provided by your administrator. The Phantom ID automatically generates the correct WebSocket server URL.
connection_settings.username_desc: Your SIP username (device number). This is the identity used when registering with the Phantom PBX server.
connection_settings.password_desc: Your SIP password for authentication. This is provided by your administrator and is securely stored locally.
connection_settings.voicemail_desc: The number to dial to access your voicemail. Default is *97. When you click the voicemail icon, this number is dialled automatically.
connection_settings.save_desc: After entering or modifying your connection details:
connection_settings.save_step2: The button will show "Saved!" when successful
connection_settings.save_step3: Return to the Phone tab and click Connect to register with the server
connection_settings.warning: Important: Saving connection settings does not automatically connect you. After saving, you must click the Connect button on the Phone tab to establish a connection with the Phantom PBX server.
connection_settings.tip: Tip: If you don't have your connection credentials, contact your system administrator or the Phantom team at support@autocab.com.

interface_settings.title: Interface Settings
interface_settings.intro: Customise the appearance and visible features of Connect365.
interface_settings.theme_desc: Choose between Auto (follows system preference), Light, or Dark mode
interface_settings.blf_panels_desc: Show or hide the Busy Lamp Field button panels on the Phone tab
interface_settings.notifications_desc: Enable or disable toast notifications for events within the app
interface_settings.tabs_desc: Control which tabs appear in the tab navigation bar:
interface_settings.tab_contacts_desc: Show or hide the Contacts tab for managing your contact list
interface_settings.tab_activity_desc: Show or hide the Activity tab for viewing call history
interface_settings.tab_company_desc: Show or hide the Company Numbers tab for accessing the company directory
interface_settings.tab_queue_desc: Show or hide the Queue Monitor tab for viewing call queue statistics

call_settings.title: Call Settings
call_settings.intro: Configure call behaviour and notifications in Settings > Call.
call_settings.auto_answer_desc: When enabled, incoming calls are automatically answered without requiring you to click the Answer button. Useful for high-volume call centres where agents need to handle calls immediately.
call_settings.notifications_desc: Show browser notifications when calls arrive. This allows you to see incoming calls even when the application is minimised or in a background tab. Requires browser notification permission.
call_settings.autofocus_desc: When you answer a call from a browser notification, automatically bring the Connect365 window to the front. Only appears when Incoming Call Notifications is enabled.
call_settings.blind_transfer_desc: When enabled, the Transfer button defaults to blind transfer (immediate transfer without consultation). When disabled, defaults to attended transfer (speak to recipient first).
call_settings.test_desc: When Incoming Call Notifications is enabled, you can test that notifications are working correctly:
call_settings.test_step2: A sample notification should appear from your browser
call_settings.test_step3: The current permission status is displayed next to the button
call_settings.test_tip: Browser Permission Required: If notifications don't appear, check that you have granted notification permission to Connect365 in your browser settings. The permission status shows as "granted", "denied", or "default" (not yet requested).

queues_settings.title: Queues Settings
queues_settings.intro: Create and manage queue groups for faster queue login.
queues_settings.what_desc: Queue groups allow you to save collections of queues that you frequently join together. Instead of selecting individual queues each time you log in, you can select a pre-configured group to quickly join multiple queues at once.
queues_settings.where_desc: Queue groups can be used in two places:
queues_settings.where_login_desc: In the Queue Login modal (accessed via the Queue button on the Phone tab), you can:
queues_settings.where_login_item1: Select individual queues from the available list
queues_settings.where_login_item2: Click a queue group to instantly select all queues in that group
queues_settings.where_monitor_desc: In the Queue Monitor tab, queue groups allow you to quickly select multiple queues when configuring SLA settings. Instead of adding SLA thresholds to each queue individually, select a queue group to apply the same SLA settings to all queues in that group at once.
queues_settings.create_step3: Enter a name for the group (e.g. "Morning Shift" or "Sales Queues")
queues_settings.create_step4: Select the queues to include in the group from the available list
queues_settings.rule1: Each queue group must have a unique name
queues_settings.rule2: A queue group must contain at least one queue
queues_settings.rule3: Each queue can only belong to one queue group - once a queue is added to a group, it cannot be added to another group
queues_settings.rule4: Queue groups are stored locally on your device
queues_settings.rules_tip: When editing a queue group, the queues already assigned to that group will remain available for selection, but queues assigned to other groups will be greyed out.
queues_settings.manage_desc: Each queue group in the list shows:
queues_settings.manage_item3: The number of queues in the group
queues_settings.manage_actions: Click the three dots menu on any group to:
queues_settings.manage_edit: Edit: Modify the group name or change the selected queues
queues_settings.manage_delete_all: Use the delete all button (trash icon) to remove all queue groups at once.

audio_settings.title: Audio Settings
audio_settings.intro: Configure your microphone, speaker, and ringtone devices in Settings > Audio.
audio_settings.permission_tip: Permission Required: Before you can select audio devices, you must grant microphone permission. Click the Grant Permission button if prompted.
audio_settings.speaker: Speaker
audio_settings.speaker_desc: The output device for call audio (hearing the other party). Click the play button to test that audio plays correctly through the selected speaker.
audio_settings.microphone_desc: The input device for your voice. When the Audio settings panel is open, a level meter shows your current microphone input in real-time.
audio_settings.ringer_desc: The output device for the ringtone when calls arrive. This can be different from your speaker - for example, use your computer speakers for ringing while using a headset for calls. Click the play button to test.
audio_settings.ringtone_preview: Click the play button next to the ringtone selector to preview the selected ringtone.
audio_settings.custom_desc: Upload your own ringtone file for a personalised experience:
audio_settings.custom_upload_step1: In the Custom Ringtone section, click Choose File
audio_settings.custom_upload_step2: Select your MP3 or WAV file from your computer
audio_settings.custom_upload_step3: The file will be validated and converted if necessary
audio_settings.custom_upload_step4: Once uploaded, "Custom ringtone available" will be displayed
audio_settings.custom_upload_step5: Select Custom from the Ringtone dropdown to use it
audio_settings.custom_remove_desc: Click the trash icon next to "Custom ringtone available" to remove your uploaded ringtone. The ringtone selection will revert to the default.
audio_settings.refresh_desc: If you connect or disconnect audio devices (headphones, microphones, etc.), click the Refresh Devices button to update the available device lists.
audio_settings.test_tip: Tip: Test all your audio devices before taking calls. Use the play buttons to verify speakers and ringer output, and watch the microphone level meter to confirm your microphone is working.

busylight_settings.title: Busylight Settings
busylight_settings.intro: Connect365 supports Kuando Busylight hardware devices, providing a visual indicator of your call status that colleagues can see from a distance.
busylight_settings.warning: Additional Software Required: To use Busylight with Connect365, you must have the Busylight Bridge Client software installed and running on your PC. This bridge software enables communication between the web application and your USB Busylight device. Contact your administrator for installation instructions.
busylight_settings.how_desc: When enabled, the Busylight automatically changes colour based on your current call status:
busylight_settings.state_white_desc: Registered but no agent logged in
busylight_settings.state_green_desc: Available and ready to take calls
busylight_settings.state_green_flash_desc: Available with new voicemail messages (when voicemail notify enabled)
busylight_settings.state_red_wait_desc: On a call with another call waiting
busylight_settings.multiline_desc: When handling multiple calls on different lines, the Busylight reflects the status of the currently selected line. If the selected line has a call on hold, the light shows yellow. If there's an active call on any line, it shows red.
busylight_settings.config_enable_desc: Turn Busylight integration on or off
busylight_settings.config_sound_desc: Select the sound the Busylight plays for incoming calls. Options include: OpenOffice, Quiet, Funky, Fairy Tale, Kuando Train, Telephone Nordic, Telephone Original, and Telephone Pick Me Up. Note: Some Busylight models do not support sound.
busylight_settings.config_volume_desc: Adjust the volume of the Busylight ring sound (0-100%)
busylight_settings.config_voicemail_desc: When enabled, the Busylight will flash green slowly when you have unread voicemail messages
busylight_settings.test_desc: Once the bridge software is running and Busylight is enabled:
busylight_settings.test_step1: The settings will show your connected Busylight device information
busylight_settings.test_step2: Click Test Connection to verify the connection is working
busylight_settings.test_step3: The Busylight should briefly flash to confirm communication
busylight_settings.test_tip: Bridge Not Connected: If you see "Bridge not connected - ensure bridge client is running", verify that the Busylight Bridge Client software is installed and currently running on your PC.

advanced_settings.title: Advanced Settings
advanced_settings.intro: Access debugging tools and data management options in Settings > Advanced.
advanced_settings.verbose_desc: Enable detailed console logging for debugging. When enabled, Connect365 outputs extensive information about its operations to the browser's developer console (F12). Useful for troubleshooting issues.
advanced_settings.sip_logging_desc: Enable SIP.js protocol message logging. This outputs raw SIP signalling messages to the console, helpful for diagnosing call setup and registration issues.
advanced_settings.import_desc: Restore previously exported settings and data:
advanced_settings.import_step3: Choose which data to import (settings, contacts, call history, etc.)
advanced_settings.export_desc: Create a backup of your settings and data:
advanced_settings.export_step2: Choose which data to include in the export
advanced_settings.export_step3: Click Export to download a JSON backup file
advanced_settings.export_note: The exported file can be used to restore your settings on another device or after reinstalling.
advanced_settings.reset_desc: Restore Connect365 to its default state:
advanced_settings.reset_warning: Warning: Reset All Settings will permanently delete ALL your data including connection credentials, contacts, call history, queue groups, and preferences. This action cannot be undone. Consider exporting your data first as a backup.
advanced_settings.export_tip: Tip: Use Export Data before making major changes or switching devices. This allows you to quickly restore your configuration if needed.

feature_index.title: Feature Index
feature_index.intro: Quick reference to all features and where to find them:
feature_index.agent_controls_desc: Login, Queue, and Pause buttons with status display
feature_index.make_calls_desc: Dial numbers and place outbound calls
feature_index.call_transfer_desc: Blind or attended transfer to another extension
feature_index.cli_selector_desc: Choose which company number displays to called party
feature_index.blf_monitoring_desc: Monitor extension status and one-click dialling
feature_index.voicemail_desc: Access voicemail with new message indicator
feature_index.call_history_desc: View recent calls and call back
feature_index.company_numbers_desc: Manage CLI numbers for outbound calls
feature_index.queue_monitor_desc: Real-time queue statistics and SLA tracking
feature_index.settings_desc: Configure connection, audio, and interface options

common_issues.title: Common Issues
common_issues.registration_desc: If you can't register with the server:
common_issues.registration_item1: Verify your Phantom ID is correct
common_issues.registration_item3: Ensure you have a stable internet connection
common_issues.audio_desc: If you can't hear the other party or they can't hear you:
common_issues.audio_item3: Try selecting a different audio device
common_issues.other_party_item1: Check if you're muted (look for the mute icon)
common_issues.other_party_item3: Test your microphone in Settings > Audio

verbose_logging.title: Enabling Verbose Logging
verbose_logging.intro: Verbose logging helps diagnose issues by providing detailed information about the application's operations.
verbose_logging.enable_step5: Share the console output with support

keyboard_shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
keyboard_shortcuts.intro: Use these keyboard shortcuts for faster operation:

support.title: Support & Feedback
support.intro: Need help or have feedback? Here's how to reach us:
support.feedback_desc: We value your feedback! Let us know how we can improve Connect365.
support.useful_info_item5: Console logs (if verbose logging is enabled)
support.browser_desc: Connect365 requires a modern browser with WebRTC support:
